flow.descriptionCdata:
8e5f58d6-21f5-42dd-8dea-14bca034dfbf.1e1a136a-71a3-43c5-a0a1-8caaf6b0e8b5.prompt=User Identifier 8e5f58d6-21f5-42dd-8dea-14bca034dfbf.27dd5338-6cb6-4706-8ac6-7c26ae62e1af.prompt=User Identifier 8e5f58d6-21f5-42dd-8dea-14bca034dfbf.27ed68ba-a186-451d-8c45-609b44249e72.description=This workflow adds/updates the component property using Artifact APIs. onlyUpdate\: yes/no yes - To update values of existing property (In this case input "valueType" is not required , This input will not be considered even if provided) no - To add/update property valueType - Value type of the property. It can have value from selection list "CSA-Property-ValueType". This Input is required only when Input "onlyUpdate" is selected as "no". values - One or more values dilimited by comma , (If user want to use some other separator for multiple values then needs to be pass as next input "separator") separator - A delimiter that separates elements in the values ( default dilimiter used is comma ,) 8e5f58d6-21f5-42dd-8dea-14bca034dfbf.59f4d663-6095-4b99-ab41-4d1c6e5a0f99.prompt=Process Instance ID 8e5f58d6-21f5-42dd-8dea-14bca034dfbf.5ee727d7-e56d-4a6e-b5ff-0d004963d632.prompt=Resource Provider ID 8e5f58d6-21f5-42dd-8dea-14bca034dfbf.66520875-dca5-4e7c-bfb7-e602b96c853f.prompt=Process Instance ID 8e5f58d6-21f5-42dd-8dea-14bca034dfbf.80857411-604b-44b5-9fed-8f324e00ab21.prompt=Process Instance ID 8e5f58d6-21f5-42dd-8dea-14bca034dfbf.80bfe5bb-4a2f-44f8-90c4-5f02c2b4353d.prompt=User Identifier 8e5f58d6-21f5-42dd-8dea-14bca034dfbf.86e59773-e597-4e09-b171-0a4b9b790b7a.prompt=User Identifier 8e5f58d6-21f5-42dd-8dea-14bca034dfbf.8ce2819d-a72a-4f6c-ad7d-23fb47ff92aa.prompt=User Identifier 8e5f58d6-21f5-42dd-8dea-14bca034dfbf.94a18d75-9b82-4bcf-b77f-6b09f10b0333.description=This workflow returns the component properties and values using Artifact APIs. result\: propertyNameValuesList\: pipe separated list of property name and values ( where each property name and values would be ; seprated and multiple values would be , seprated) e.g. - property 1; value1,value2|property 2; value3|property 3; value3,value4|........ 8e5f58d6-21f5-42dd-8dea-14bca034dfbf.998161ad-ad4f-4f03-8b19-944090eac628.description=Changes a VM's power state. Must specify either hostSystem, clusterName, or vmResourcePool as a target location for VMs. Input Parameters\: vmName - name of the VM that will be created with this flow templateName - name of the VM template to clone in vCenter osType - linux or windows host - vCenter host to execute against user - vCenter username password - vCenter password vmDatacenter - target Datacenter on the vCenter host for the VMs dataStore - target datastore on the vCenter host for the VMs hostSystem - target ESX host for the VMs clusterName - target cluster for the VMs vmResourcePool - target resource pool for the VMs vmPowerState - the desired power state (on / off etc) Responses\: success - if the command completes execution and its exit code is 0 failure - otherwise Result Fields\: serviceXml - xml representation of the server created in vCenter 8e5f58d6-21f5-42dd-8dea-14bca034dfbf.9c703938-2adf-4022-a1f3-5d3dfe21016d.description=
Adds a flow variable into the local context (available to itself and child flows only)

Input Parameters\:
keyName - the name of the flow variable to use
myValue - the value to assign the flow variable

Responses\:
success - assigned the flow variable

Scriptlet Example\:
[$scriptletContext putGlobal\: $keyName, $myValue];
8e5f58d6-21f5-42dd-8dea-14bca034dfbf.a58df24d-bbda-4f10-9e66-7e598f9c2b02.prompt=Artifact ID 8e5f58d6-21f5-42dd-8dea-14bca034dfbf.a7be27e7-2773-4e84-a153-9307fa44be6f.description=This workflow updates the Process Instance State using PEM API. Inputs\: _PROCESS_INSTANCE_ID - Process Instance Id _processInstanceState - Process Instance State (Use value from selection list CSA-ProcessInstance-State) Result\: _processInstanceState -Updated Process Instance State 8e5f58d6-21f5-42dd-8dea-14bca034dfbf.b3f6dee7-c232-4c9f-a4e2-340fc80c38cf.description=This workflow updates the Process Instance State using PEM API. Inputs\: _PROCESS_INSTANCE_ID - Process Instance Id _processInstanceState - Process Instance State (Use value from selection list CSA-ProcessInstance-State) Result\: _processInstanceState -Updated Process Instance State 8e5f58d6-21f5-42dd-8dea-14bca034dfbf.c49a6af1-5752-431d-b1b3-86633fe08fe2.prompt=User Identifier 8e5f58d6-21f5-42dd-8dea-14bca034dfbf.c97afc4e-2f18-4fd2-b2ef-24c7e7dc0ea5.prompt=Component ID 8e5f58d6-21f5-42dd-8dea-14bca034dfbf.def11623-d2cf-4175-ad58-6cec5c4d8195.description=This workflow updates the Process Instance State using PEM API. Inputs\: _PROCESS_INSTANCE_ID - Process Instance Id _processInstanceState - Process Instance State (Use value from selection list CSA-ProcessInstance-State) Result\: _processInstanceState -Updated Process Instance State 8e5f58d6-21f5-42dd-8dea-14bca034dfbf.description=
Stop the Virtual Machine

Inputs Parameters\:

 CSA_CONTEXT_ID – CSA Context Id
 CSA_PROCESS_ID – CSA Process Instance Id
 SVC_COMPONENT_ID - This token will resolve to the Service component Id. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\:SVC_COMPONENT_ID]
 RSC_PROVIDER_ID - This token will resolve to the Resource Provider Id that was selected at the Subscription time. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\:RSC_PROVIDER_ID]
 SVC_SUBSCRIPTION_EMAIL - This token will resolve to the subscriber’s email address. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: SVC_SUBSCRIPTION_EMAIL]
 RSC_SUBSCRIPTION_ID - This token will resolve to the Resource Subscription Id that was created from the Resource Offering at the Subscription time.
  		Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: RSC_SUBSCRIPTION_ID]
 SVC_COMPONENT_TYPE - This token will resolve to the Service component type. Eg\: Server.. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: SVC_COMPONENT_TYPE]
 RSC_POOL_ID - This token will resolve to the Resource pool Id that was selected at the Subscription time. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: RSC_POOL_ID]
 SVC_INSTANCE_ID - This token will resolve to the Service Instance Id. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: SVC_INSTANCE_ID]
 SVC_SUBSCRIPTION_ID - This token will resolve to the Subscription Id that was created at the Subscription time. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: SVC_SUBSCRIPTION_ID]
 PRN_COMPONENT_ID – This token will resolve to the parent Component’s Service Component Id. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: PRN_COMPONENT_ID]
 REQ_ORG_ID - This token will resolve to the Organization Id associated with the service request. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: REQ_ORG_ID]
 REQ_USER_ID - This token will resolve to the User Id associated with the service request. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: REQ_USER_ID]
 USR_ORG_ID - This token will resolve to the Organization Id associated with the subscriber. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: USR_ORG_ID]
 RSC_BINDING_ID - This token will resolve to the Resource Binding Id that was created at the Subscription time. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: RSC_BINDING_ID]

Responses\:
 success - The operation completed successfully.
 failure - Something went wrong.
flow.name: vCenter Stop Server
